data.title: Exceeded Expectations
data.text: Good food, generous portions, great staff and elegant setting for a family dinner, birthday outing, celebrations etc.  We lived in the area for so long, I am surprised we didn't discover this place earlier.  Definitely going back there soon and often.

data.title: Consistent and good food
data.text: We go here when we want to get a quick bite and are craving Mexican food and a margi. We have been going to El Pescador for years and years, when it was in Whittier as well as the La Mirada location. This by far, is the nicest, they really did a nice job with the decorating. We usually get the ceviche and/or shrimp tostadas, consistently good. We once ate in the bar and it was so loud we vowed never to do that again. They're not the best margarita's but they are still good. Service can be somewhat shotty, you have some really good servers and some mediocre servers. Nevertheless, we still keep coming back.

data.title: Nice outside patio
data.text: This was our first visit to this particular location and we liked the outside patio area very much. Plenty of room inside as well as a large over 21 bar area. Margaritas are very good and the food portions are generous. Yummy seafood and tasty Mexican favorites. We had 2 large Margaritas, one regular flavor at $7.77 and a specialty flavor at $9.99 and two entrees, one plate with grilled fish and the other plate had 1 carnitas taco and a chicken enchilada. My husband said the taco and enchilada were stuffed with lots of meat and very good. About $60 out the door, so definitely not cheap, it would be considered kinda pricey, but we thought it was worth it.

data.title: Good food, but pricey.
data.text: We're always on the lookout for good Mexican food and found it here. The food was delicious, but not good enough to overlook bad service.  When the restaurant is fairly crowded I understand time is an issue, but when your waiter walks by your table numerous times without looking your way, it's ridiculous.  We also find it annoying when there are only two of us eating and one plate was brought out 10 minutes before the second.

data.title: Best Mexican Food North of the Border!
data.text: This restaurant is located on the south side of the Plaza West Covina Mall.  You have your choice of sitting in the bar (but it can be a bit noisy) or the more traditional dining room.  Whichever you choose, you will be treated to the best Mexican food north of the border!  Trust me, the food is delicious.  The staff is friendly and the service is prompt.  What more could you ask for?  We'll definitely return for what will undoubtedly be another delicious meal.

data.title: Fathers Day Visit
data.text: Great place to come once in a while with the family. Food is good and prices are reasonable. Be ready to wait for an hour to be seated inside Or a few minutes for outside seating.

data.title: It's alright
data.text:
Went to this New Mexican restaurant, since my family is big fan of Mexican food.

Firstly, this place is beautiful the decor is lovely and it's very spacious so you know you can bring big parties of people and be comfortable.

Yes this place is a Mexican restaurant but they have a variety of seafood because after all it's Called El Pescador.🐟

We had a waitress who knew nothing about vegetarian meal options, when we asked her for suggestions she said "the chicken salad is really good" LOL someone needed an overview of what vegetarian means. 

They have a good happy hour from 10-3
so we ordered the mojito which was delicious. I'd go back just for that. 

The chips are good nice crisp to it. The salsa is tasty, they also two different types of haberno salsa incase you want something more spicy.  

Anyway, we ordered a cheese enchilada plate and a chile rellano plate both came with rice and beans some salad could be cactus but not sure and a scoop of guacamole which was a pleasant surprise.

The presentation of the dishes was pretty. 
But the food it self was OK, the it wasn't warm or anything felt like it was room temperature. Which sucks when you expect food to be hot.

data.title: Excellent Mexican food.
data.text: El Pescador is a welcome addition to West Covina dining. Truly good authentic Mexican food. I recommend any of the shrimp dishes and they also have excellent carnitas.

data.title: Good food and nice ambience
data.text:
El Pescador is a new restaurant located outside the west Covina Plaza mall. 
We stooped here for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and were surprised to find a nice selection of happy hour specials besides the regular menu.
The restaurant has a warm feeling to it with nice décor as well as a separate bar area besides the dinning room.
Plenty of televisions around the bar let you watch your favorite team as you relax on comfortable high chairs.
The chips and salsa are very good and tasteful and the food did not disappoint either.
Everything was served hot and delicious but on the spicy side.
The happy hour specials are an especially good deal and there are plenty of dishes to choose from. Servers and waiters were very helpful and friendly.
